meanings.definition: Synchronize: to cause to occur or operate at the same time or rate
meanings.sent1: I am synching my phone with my computer to transfer files.
meanings.sent2: The dancers were synching their movements to the music.
meanings.sent3: The chef was synching the timing of the dishes to create a perfect meal.
meanings.sent4: The team members were synching their efforts to achieve a common goal.
meanings.sent5: The conductor was synching the orchestra to create a harmonious performance.

meanings.definition: Synchronization: the act or process of synchronizing
meanings.sent1: The synching of the clocks ensured everyone was on time.
meanings.sent2: The synchronization of the traffic lights improved the flow of cars.
meanings.sent3: The synchronization of the dance moves made the performance captivating.
meanings.sent4: The synchronization of the team's actions led to a successful project.
meanings.sent5: The synchronization of the gears made the machine run smoothly.

meanings.definition: Synchronized: happening at the same time or rate
meanings.sent1: The synchronized swimmers moved gracefully in perfect harmony.
meanings.sent2: The synchronized clocks showed the exact same time.
meanings.sent3: The synchronized clapping of the audience added to the excitement.
meanings.sent4: The synchronized heartbeats of the runners showed their unity.
meanings.sent5: The synchronized movements of the dancers mesmerized the audience.
